SENT.plain: Central nervous system (CNS) involvement is rare in scleroderma unless there are concomitant abnormalities in renal or lung function or malignant hypertension
A 43-year-old woman with typical scleroderma developed subacute encephalopathy despite absence of the above abnormalities
Cerebral angiography demonstrated a focal arteritis
The patient improved while being given corticosteroids
We believe this case indicates that cerebral arteritis can occur in scleroderma
